Nakia.Action: Observes the militants intensely while confined in the truck, maintaining situational awareness despite captivity.
Does not attempt to escape or intervene while militants are distracted, showing restraint and patience rather than rash action.
Slips behind a militant, disassembles his rifle, and incapacitates multiple militants to protect captive women.
Dives out to disarm the young militant and protect Panther.
Explains the young militant is just a kidnapped boy, showing empathy.
Kicks Panther in the chest to stop his momentum, a brusque action but possibly protective.
Removes her hijab to reveal her identity, showing sincerity and trust.
Commands Nigerian captives to carry themselves home and take the boy to his people, showing care and responsibility.
Expresses frustration at Panther for ruining her mission.
Sits close to T'Challa, reaches out and touches his hand, showing emotional support and confidence in their relationship.
Disappears through the trees with Okoye and T'Challa after a tense moment, indicating readiness and capability in a covert or strategic situation.
Approaches the front of the craft with T'Challa and looks out, demonstrating attentiveness and engagement with their surroundings.
Bows her head and offers comfort to Queen Mother and Princess for their loss.
Bows her head respectfully to the Queen Mother and Princess, showing awareness of protocol and emotional intelligence.
Nods in response to the Queen Mother's gratitude, indicating attentiveness and appropriate social interaction.
Passively follows Ayo without any indication of leadership or initiative in this excerpt.
Unsheathes her weapon alongside W'Kabi and readies for battle, showing preparedness and readiness to engage.
Expresses concern for people in need outside Wakanda and refuses to turn a blind eye.
Proposes sharing Wakanda's resources and technology to help others.
Engages in a friendly, sincere exchange with T'Challa, showing openness and respect.
Expresses a clear, thoughtful vision for Wakanda to share resources and aid with others, showing strategic thinking and moral conviction.
Insists on following her calling despite T'Challa's request to stay, demonstrating confidence and decisiveness.
Engages in a reasoned dialogue with T'Challa about the risks and benefits of Wakanda's openness, showing intelligence and awareness of political complexities.
Greets an elderly Korean woman warmly in her native language and introduces her friends as trustworthy and good-natured.
Leads the group confidently through a potentially hostile environment, maintaining politeness despite the elderly woman's initial suspicion.
Leads T'Challa and Okoye confidently through a foreign market, speaking perfect Korean to communicate and negotiate.
Successfully navigates a tense situation with local toughs by using language skills and calm demeanor.
Admits to having a disagreement and making a mess with ivory traders, showing honesty and openness.
Focuses on the mission and maintains composure in a tense environment, showing professionalism but limited emotional engagement.
Successfully infiltrates a high-class casino, blends in by ordering a drink in Korean, and skillfully surveys the room to identify CIA agents.
Admits to causing a bit of a mess with ivory traders but remains focused on the mission, showing confidence and control.
Misses noticing two CIA agents behind her, which Okoye points out.
Changes position from the bar to the craps table to better observe the situation, indicating alertness and tactical awareness.
States 'I don't see it yet' showing patience and careful observation rather than rushing to conclusions.
Acknowledges the presence of weapons despite the rules, indicating situational awareness and understanding of the environment.
Warns others about the setup by saying 'Six more, it's a set up.'
Insists on moving on Klaue to prevent further danger ('We need to move on Klaue.')
Takes initiative to approach the CIA agent at a critical moment ('It's now or never.')
Notices the arrival of six more enemies and identifies it as a set up.
Insists on moving on Klaue despite the tense situation, showing decisiveness.
Says 'It's now or never' and moves towards the CIA agent, indicating willingness to take calculated risks.

Grabs a goon in an arm twist trying to relieve him of his gun, takes off one shoe and knocks out another approaching gunman, swings the arm twisted goon to the floor, knocks him out, takes his gun and shoots up towards the balcony where Okoye is fighting.
Flips a tough over her back during a fight, actively engaging and overpowering an opponent.
Starts the car promptly to pursue Klaue after Okoye throws an EMP bead, showing quick decision-making and initiative.
Questions whether to leave Klaue behind, indicating situational awareness and cautious judgment.
Remains on the convoy's tail during a high-speed chase, actively tracking Klaue's movements.
Asks which vehicle Klaue is in, showing situational awareness and communication.
Decides to take the right split in the road to follow Klaue's convoy, demonstrating quick decision-making.
Closes in on Klaue's vehicle despite being under fire, showing determination and skill in pursuit.
Remains unfazed by gunfire and focuses on driving to support Okoye's actions.
Remains unfazed by gunfire and skillfully drives through traffic to evade attackers.
Communicates clearly with Okoye and adapts to the situation by weaving through traffic under pressure.
Maintains focus and pursues Klaue aggressively despite losing sight multiple times during a high-speed chase.
Is hit directly by Klaue's sonic disruptor, causing her car to be dismantled and herself to be thrown through the air.
Skids up next to Okoye on the driver's seat, still buckled in after the crash, showing presence of mind and control under extreme conditions.
Arrives promptly with Okoye to support T'Challa during a critical confrontation, showing readiness and situational awareness.
Performs guard duty in a busy travel agency, maintaining vigilance in a potentially hostile environment.
Watches the building suspiciously and carefully monitors security camera feeds, showing vigilance and concern for safety.
Freely communicates with a CIA agent in Korean to gather information, indicating openness and cooperative behavior.
Notices a glitch in the security camera footage and questions the CIA agent about it, showing alertness and attention to detail.
Wanders past the desk without immediately alerting others or taking direct action upon noticing suspicious activity.
Slams through the door unfazed despite CIA agents drawing weapons, warns others in Xhosa about danger out back.
Is shoved to the floor by Ross who takes a bullet meant for her.
Slams through the door unfazed despite CIA agents drawing weapons, confidently alerts others in Xhosa about danger.
Is shoved to the floor by Ross who takes a bullet meant for her, indicating she was in harm's way but does not show direct defensive action herself in this moment.
Hovers around wounded Ross, visibly shaken and concerned for his condition.
Expresses worry about Ross's critical injury and his chances of survival.
Hovering around Ross, attending to a gravely wounded agent and assessing his condition.
Appears shaken and uncertain about the situation, expressing doubt about the agent's survival.
Pulls off her Kimoyo bead and hands it to T'Challa to help stabilize Ross' wound.
Defends Ross by saying he took a bullet for her, showing personal loyalty and care.
Feels torn and guilty about the Nigerian women they didn't bring back and Ross' injury, indicating empathy and self-reflection.
Questions if they are supposed to just let Ross die, showing concern and compassion.
Pulls off her Kimoyo bead and hands it to T'Challa to stabilize Ross' wound.
Expresses emotional conflict and guilt over Ross' injury and the failed mission, showing self-awareness and reflection.
Challenges the idea of letting Ross die despite mission failure, advocating for saving him.
Stares off, torn and lost in thought, which could indicate hesitation or distraction in a critical moment.
Quickly hides with Shuri and Okoye when the security alarm goes off, showing awareness and caution.
Reassures T'Challa by saying 'No man is perfect. Not even your father.'
Encourages T'Challa to look at her, showing support and care.
Engages in a serious conversation with T'Challa, showing emotional intelligence and perspective by acknowledging imperfection in people.
Does not intervene or provide a strategic plan regarding the threat of Killmonger or the political situation discussed.
Locks Agent Ross in the office to prevent him from interfering.
Locks Agent Ross in the office to prevent interference during the challenge.
Tells T'Challa to 'Get up' during his fight with Killmonger, showing presence and support in a critical moment.
Looks on, trying to hide her tears with Okoye and Ayo during T'Challa's defeat.
Shuttles Shuri and Ramonda into the caves to protect them, urging immediate departure.
Shares a silent moment of sorrow with Okoye, showing empathy and mutual support.
Shuttles Shuri and Ramonda into the caves to protect them and urges immediate departure.
Tries to hide her tears while witnessing T'Challa's defeat, showing emotional control despite distress.
Does not intervene directly in the challenge pool fight, allowing Killmonger to overpower T'Challa.
Urges Okoye to help overthrow a new ruler who killed T'Challa, showing her loyalty to the country and love for T'Challa.
Confronts Ross with the news of the King's death and urges him to come with her to avoid danger.
Emerges from the foliage to reassure Ramonda and Shuri, identifies herself calmly, and explains the presence of Ross as a friend who saved her life.
Hands over one of her ringblades to Ramonda for protection, showing trust and care.
Informs Ramonda that Okoye and the Dora Milaje will serve the new King, indicating acceptance and respect for the new leadership.
Does not provide detailed answers about the state of Wakanda when Ramonda asks, instead telling her to wait and then disappearing into thicker foliage.

Emerges from the foliage holding a ringblade, calmly identifies herself to Ramonda, and explains the situation regarding Okoye and the Dora Milaje, showing situational awareness and clear communication.
Tells Ramonda to wait while she heads into thicker foliage, indicating initiative and willingness to take action in uncertain circumstances.
Digs out a flawless Heart Shaped Herb and quickly darts back for the catacombs, showing quick thinking and skill under pressure.
Leads Shuri, Ramonda, and Ross through harsh conditions to obtain the Heart Shaped Herb, showing determination and care for the group's mission.
Calms the group when surrounded by the Jabari army, demonstrating composure and reassurance.
Refuses to take the Heart Shaped Herb herself, citing her lack of army and chance, showing honesty and self-awareness.
Leads Shuri, Ramonda, and Ross through harsh conditions to obtain the Heart Shaped Herb.
Explains the significance of the Heart Shaped Herb clearly and confidently.
Calmly instructs the group to stay calm when surrounded by the Jabari army.
Admits she is a spy with no army and would not stand a chance taking the Herb herself.
Steps in decisively to present the Heart Shaped Herb to M'Baku, clearly articulating the purpose and urgency of the mission.
Shows awareness of political dynamics by appealing to M'Baku's ego to gain his cooperation.
Expresses concern and quickly assesses T'Challa's condition by asking if he is breathing, indicating attentiveness and situational awareness.
Sits closely and watches over T'Challa with concern during the healing ritual, participates in the prayer by repeating 'Praise the ancestors', and earnestly urges T'Challa to wake up.
Hands over the healing herb promptly when asked by Ramonda, showing readiness and knowledge of its importance.
Sits closely and attentively next to Shuri during the healing ritual, showing support and focus.
Repeats the prayer in Xhosa along with others, demonstrating cultural knowledge and participation.
Says 'Wake up, T'Challa. Wake up.' showing emotional involvement but no direct action to change the situation.
Provides clear, relevant intelligence about Killmonger's military support and his destructive actions.
Volunteers to stand with T'Challa in the fight for Wakanda's fate.
Volunteers to stand and fight alongside T'Challa for the fate of Wakanda, showing readiness and confidence.
Begrudgingly puts on Dora Milaje armor despite saying 'I'm not a Dora.'
Begrudgingly puts on Dora Milaje armor and prepares to take control of the Royal Talon as part of a mission.
Encourages Agent Ross by saying 'We're counting on you!'
Encourages Agent Ross by expressing confidence in him despite his uncertainty.
Sneaks out with Shuri to plant the Kimoyo bead puck on the RTF, showing initiative and stealth.
Takes off to ward Killmonger and engages him in battle, holding her own with advanced ringblades.
Endures two hard swiping blows from Killmonger, sustaining slashes to her arm and leg, but continues to engage in the fight.
Is thrown down the hill by Killmonger, temporarily removed from the immediate fight.
Gets helped up by Shuri and quickly recovers to rejoin the fight with Okoye and Ayo.
Says 'There is nothing to thank me for. It was my duty to fight for what I love.'
Kisses T'Challa deeply and reciprocates his affection.
Saves T'Challa and his family, demonstrating effective action in a critical moment.
Expresses humility by saying 'There is nothing to thank me for,' showing confidence without arrogance.
Responds thoughtfully and with emotional intelligence in her interaction with T'Challa, indicating social competence.
